data.title: Friendly place, if not completely authentic Italian
data.text: Great happy hour - Good prices on beer, wine and well drinks, and a fair selection of $5 appetizers.  The meatball sliders were delicious.  The tiramisu was tasty, but do yourself a favor and avoid the coffee.  I initially asked for cappuccino, and was brought weak, black coffee.  When I asked where the foam was that one would find on a typical cappuccino, I was told that the server had "pushed the button for cappuccino" (don't every say that to an Italian), but "apparently the machine was not working".  When I said that I would just have regular coffee, I was brought - you guessed it - weak, black coffee, apparently made by the same machine, which makes (supposedly), espresso, Americano, and cappuccino.  They were gracious enough to not charge me for the coffee, although I did drink it just to cut the sweetness of the tiramisu.  Friendly, well meaning staff.

data.title: Great outdoor bar
data.text: Great outdoor bar offering a very rewarding ambiance.  Unique menu of appetizers and main dishes.  I had the calamari and it was perfect.  Great dipping sauce and generous portion.  Great wine selection.  Service was phenomenal.  Great place to meet up with friends and have an enjoyable evening.

data.title: Unique, fresh, delicious
data.text: My husband and I went to Crust in downtown Chandler last week and were delightfully surprised by the unique menu, the fabulous service and food that was absolutely delicious.  Crust has many specials that further enhance an already awesome menu.

data.title: Can't wait to go back
data.text: We went here on a Wednesday evening with the family. The food was great and the wine ( Chardonnay and a Pinot Grigio) were very smooth and well picked out for the menu. The food was great. We had the bruschetta, pick 4 , a Greek salad and the chicken pesto pizza. Delish. We also had the chicken parm and the Mac n cheese, loved it all. Even had a few cannollis. We will go back. The only thing I would change is its a bit dark in there and a bit chilly with all those fans.

data.title: Great food exceptional service
data.text: My wife and I came here for lunch. A little to loud inside so we dined out side. The waitress was kind and quick to wait on every need and we both had an amazing meal. I will come again and again.  Thanks Tony.

data.title: Nice place for a quick bite and a cold beer
data.text:
My wife and I have visited Crust quite a few time over the past month and we have never been disappointed.  The Beer is cold (a big deal in Arizona!).  The food is good and the portions are large.  The service is always quick, friendly and fun!
The salads are delicious and the meatball sliders are a really good value for $5.00 during happy hour!  So far we have tried about 30% of the menu and have not been disappointed!

data.title: Good
data.text:
I have eaten at this restaurant in the last month at least 10 times and have yet to have anything I didn't enjoy

Their happy hour food is great

I would recommend it happy hour starts at 4 p.m.

data.title: Mediocre Pizza
data.text: I ordered the "God Mother" pizza and requested to add chicken. (They charge $7 to add chicken, which to me seems high.) The pizza was pretty disappointing. It  barely had any bacon and it had way too much pesto, that was pretty much all I tasted. For the amount they charge I was expecting it to be a lot better. Don't think I'll be back.

data.title: Finally.....
data.text:
Finally a place that's going to stick at this corner of the San Marcos resort. 

This was my first time stopping into this place and I had some family in town and figured I would give this place a try. They offer a the typical Italian food that you would most likely see anywhere. The great thing about the place is portion size and prices. The personal pizza is a huge pizza slice. It's easily over a 12 inch pizza slice. It will fill you up. 3 people walked out of the place with leftovers for each person and cost us under $40.

data.title: Bruschetta just like Italy!
data.text: I stopped in her for lunch with a friend and my mom. We had two pasta dishes and a salad as well as bruschetta. The lunch items were all well-prepared and hot. The bruschetta was amazing. Some of the best I've ever had and I've been to Italy a few times!! Not kidding! Anyhow, the staff was very friendly and the restaurant was clean and read for the lunch crowd when we arrived at 11. If you are in the Chandler area, give Crust a try for some quick, but very good American-Italian eats!

data.title: Just Perfect!   Everything was just PERFECT!
data.text: I can't say enough about our new favorite spot in old downtown Chandler!   Great service, fun vibe, and awesome food.  Portions are ample, drinks are well mixed, and every visit has impressed us!   We had Calamari, Chicken Parmigiana, and Shrimp tonight.   All were wonderful.  Nice wine and beer selection, and fun indoor outdoor seating.  Don't miss this one!   Go with a date, couples, business, or family.   It perfect for all occasions.   Destined to be a long term Chandler favorite!

data.title: Great place
data.text: We've been there twice and enjoy the food, the wait staff and the patio dining.  The staff is always pleasant and efficient and the food is great.  We did the Happy Hour wine and apps - great apps and good wine.  We will be going back again.

data.title: Noisy when crowded, slow service
data.text: At lunch on weekday during bridge tournament.  Very crowded and service was extremely slow (45 minutes before order taken).  Food was okay once it arrived though friend's chicken was dry. Reasonable prices.

data.title: Great Pizza/Italian Restaurant
data.text: Nice relaxing Italian restaurant. Service was excellent. Had the Stromboli which was good. Parking is always a challenge.

data.title: Great food, location and view in Downtown Chandler.
data.text:
We took our visiting friends from Minnesota for lunch after walking through downtown shops and enjoying the views.  We had a combination of different salads and sandwiches and all were wonderful.  The selection of beers and wine was very good and the service was fine even though it was very busy.  If you are going in the evening and the parking is difficult, use the new valet parking found on Boston street in front of Bourbon Jack's.  If you are 'bar people', the ladies in your party will be happy to find hooks under the bar for their purses.  Don't you wish ALL places were smart enough to have them installed for safety and convenience for all. 

Our next trip will include trying some of the Italian meals and/or pizza.  Enjoy!!

data.title: A fun neighborhood pizza restaurant.
data.text: Crust is in the downtown Chandler area.  We had a wonderful Sunday dinner there with friends. It was delicious!  We started with the bruschetta board (try the apple and fig!) and the shared a pizza.  We requested extra sauce and got a generous helping.  They served one half at a time so the second slice was hot.  The service was excellent and atmosphere was nice.  There is an outdoor patio also.

data.title: Just had cocktails and drinks
data.text: I was hoping for a gin and diet tonic water but they could not provide me with diet tonic water. Two guests had Bloody Mary's and another guess had a beer. My one friend tried this Prosecco drink with some exotic favors. She did not like it at all. The guest told the bar tender she did not like the drink. The gracious bartender made her another drink to satisfy the customer.  It's a very friendly place. We did not eat at Crust but the najority of orders were their delicious pizzas.

data.title: vey nice happy hour!
data.text:
This is a pizza parlor at the San Marcos Hotel in Downtown Chandler.  It is EXTREMELY hard to find a place to park.  Near impossible.  The city needs to build a parking garage or something.  
Very nice size restaurant.  Totally impressed with the manager or hostess?  She came to table to thank us for coming (party of 15) and said she had remembered our booking.  That was very nice.
The pizza was very good.  The individual size was huge.  My only drawback is it was served on a wood cutting board.  I just don't know how sanitary you can get wood boards?
Meatball sliders were awesome.
great happy hour.

data.title: Good Food, Good Prices
data.text:
We have had the Crust pizza at the ballpark but had never eaten at the restaurant.

We went for lunch and were immediately impressed with the specials--- both the variety and the prices.

My wife had the pizza and salad special; a choice of Caesar or Garden salad and a slice of pizza.  She also had a glass of Malbec wine ( price $5 ) and it was a nice pour.

I had penne pasta w/ meatballs and it was a very healthy portion and came with a side roll.  Since I didn't know they also served Sicilian style pizza, I tried a slice of that as well and a soft drink. I could not finish everything.

Our bill before tip was only $24.

Michael was our server and in addition to great service, he was very informative in explaining the history of the owner and the restaurant.  He also explained that the dinner portions are even bigger than lunch.

Located in downtown Chandler, this has an industrial feel and opens to a nice sidewalk seating area.   This is definitely a place to visit again.

data.title: Regret to Say
data.text: We were excited to try Crust, but regret to inform you, pass on this one. The service was good, but the food was average at best. It was extremely loud and we could barely speak to each other (party of four), let alone communicate with our waiter. We tried bruschetta (people look to Postino's for what this could be), a thin crust pizza, a sicillian (thick crust) and a pasta dish. All average at best. We all had drinks (beer, wine, and mixed * 2), and our bill was $150 before tip. Glad I tried it and support Chandler whenever we can, but not going back.
